definitions.definition: Activity for amusement only, especially among the young.
Similar activity in young animals, as they explore their environment and learn new skills.
definitions.example: This kind of play helps the young lion cubs develop their hunting skills.

definitions.definition: The conduct, or course, of a game.
definitions.example: After the rain break, play resumed at 3 o'clock.

definitions.definition: An individual's performance in a sport or game.
definitions.example: His play has improved a lot this season.

definitions.definition: A short sequence of action within a game.
definitions.example: That was a great play by the Mudchester Rovers forward.

definitions.definition: (turn-based games) An action carried out when it is one's turn to play.
A literary composition, intended to be represented by actors impersonating the characters and speaking the dialogue.
definitions.example: This book contains all of Shakespeare's plays.

definitions.definition: A theatrical performance featuring actors.
definitions.example: We saw a two-act play in the theatre.

definitions.definition: A major move by a business or investor.
definitions.example: ABC Widgets makes a play in the bicycle market with its bid to take over Acme Sprockets.

definitions.definition: A geological formation that contains an accumulation or prospect of hydrocarbons or other resources.
The extent to which a part of a mechanism can move freely.
definitions.example: No wonder the fanbelt is slipping: there’s too much play in it.

definitions.definition: Sexual activity or sexual role-playing.
An instance of watching or listening to digital media.
A button that, when pressed, causes media to be played.
(now usually in compounds) Activity relating to martial combat or fighting.
To act in a manner such that one has fun; to engage in activities expressly for the purpose of recreation or entertainment.
To perform in (a sport); to participate in (a game).
To take part in amorous activity; to make love.
To act as the indicated role, especially in a performance.
definitions.example: He plays the King, and she's the Queen.

definitions.definition: (heading) To produce music or theatre.
(heading) To behave in a particular way.
To move in any manner; especially, to move regularly with alternate or reciprocating motion; to operate.
definitions.example: He played the torch beam around the room.

definitions.definition: To move to and fro.
To put in action or motion.
definitions.example: to play a trump in a card game

definitions.definition: To keep in play, as a hooked fish in order to land it.
To manipulate, deceive, or swindle someone.
